prompt: Photorealistic wide-angle shot (16:9 aspect ratio) capturing an expert Chinese art appraiser's hands meticulously examining a small, intricately carved Qing dynasty jade pendant with a loupe. The scene is set on a polished dark wood table, strewn with appraisal tools like calipers, soft brushes, and reference books with Chinese characters. Soft, focused overhead lighting illuminates the jade piece and the appraiser's hands (wearing white cotton gloves), creating subtle shadows and highlighting the texture of the jade and the aged paper of the books. The background is softly blurred, suggesting a professional, quiet office environment. Style: Cinematic, shallow depth of field, professional realism. --ar 16:9
name: chinese-art-appraisal-image-1.png

prompt: A panoramic view (16:9 aspect ratio) inside a well-lit, modern conservation studio. A senior Asian art appraiser, wearing professional attire, carefully unrolls a long, delicate Chinese silk landscape scroll painting across a large, clean white examination table. Natural light streams in from large windows to the side, illuminating the subtle ink washes and intricate details of the scroll. The appraiser holds a thin pointer, indicating a specific detail. The composition emphasizes the length of the scroll and the meticulous nature of the examination process. Background shows conservation equipment and rolled scrolls on shelves. Style: Clean, bright, documentary realism. --ar 16:9
name: chinese-art-appraisal-image-2.png

prompt: Medium shot (16:9 aspect ratio) focusing on a valuable Ming dynasty blue and white porcelain vase standing on a rotating display stand under focused gallery spotlights. An appraiser, visible from the waist up, wearing dark professional clothing, gently touches the base of the vase (wearing gloves) while holding a small UV flashlight to inspect for repairs or maker's marks. The background is a minimalist, high-end gallery wall, perhaps with one other out-of-focus artwork, creating a sense of exclusivity and value. Lighting is dramatic, highlighting the form and glaze of the porcelain. Style: Sophisticated, high-contrast, commercial photorealism. --ar 16:9
name: chinese-art-appraisal-image-3.png

prompt: A wide establishing shot (16:9 aspect ratio) depicting a consultation scene. An elegantly dressed female appraiser stands beside a large, framed contemporary Chinese ink wash painting hanging on a gallery wall. She is engaged in conversation with a potential client or collector, gesturing towards the artwork. The gallery space is bright and airy, with polished concrete floors and high ceilings. Other abstract Chinese artworks are visible but blurred in the background. The lighting is even and naturalistic, simulating daylight within a modern gallery. Style: Architectural digest, professional, clean lines, realistic. --ar 16:9
name: chinese-art-appraisal-image-4.png

prompt: Over-the-shoulder shot (16:9 aspect ratio) focusing on an appraiser working late in a traditional study or library. The room is filled with bookshelves laden with Chinese art history volumes and auction catalogues. A warm desk lamp illuminates a cluttered antique wooden desk where the appraiser (perhaps an older, scholarly man) compares a small ancient bronze ritual vessel held carefully in one hand to high-resolution images displayed on a large computer monitor. Notes and reference materials are scattered across the desk. The atmosphere is studious and intimate, emphasizing the research aspect of appraisal. Style: Atmospheric, warm lighting, academic realism, detailed environment. --ar 16:9
name: chinese-art-appraisal-image-5.png
